biospec_descr.textblock: The metagenome was obtained from biopsy specimen.

brief_summary.textblock:
There might be a correlation between gastric mucosal microbiome and mucosal pattern
      visualized by confocal laser endomicroscope.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Confocal Laser Endomicroscopic (CLE) Features and Gastric Mucosal Microbiome

detailed_description.textblock:
The gastric mucosal microbiome plays a pivotal role in a series of diseases, such as the
      H.pylori infection. We hypothesized that mucosal patterns, here visualized by confocal
      endomicroscopy, may constitute specific microbiome niches.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

          -  Patients scheduled for gastroendoscopy  examination

          -  Aged between 18 and 80 years old

        Exclusion criteria:

          -  Antibiotic, probiotic or prebiotic usage within 2months

          -  Esophageal, gastric or duodenal cancer or other malignancy

          -  History of upper GI tract surgery

          -  Coagulopathy or bleeding disorders

          -  Allergy to fluorescein sodium

          -  Pregnant or breast-feeding (for females)

          -  Impaired renal function

study_pop.textblock: Prospective patients scheduled for pCLE examination at Qilu Hospital, Shandong University

intervention.intervention_name: endomicroscopy, targeted biopsy and 16s rRNA gene sequencing

facility.name: Department of Gastroenterology, Qilu Hospital, Shandong University

clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Confocal Laser Endomicroscopic (CLE) Features and Gastric Mucosal Microbiome

primary_outcome.measure: The operational taxonomy units in gastric mucosal microbiome

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: The diagnostic accuracy of endomicroscopy compared to pathology.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
